required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Use of Bone-borne Guides in Orthognathic Surgery Cases
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Use of Bone-borne CAD/CAM Surgical Guides in Orthognathic Surgery Cases Requiring Le Fort I Osteotomy

brief_summary.textblock: The present study was conducted to evaluate a new design of the intermediate stent that is used in orthognathic surgery cases requiring Le Fort I osteotomy. The new design relied on referencing the maxillary segment to the zygomatic buttress. The study was carried out as a randomized controlled clinical trial in which 16 patients were enrolled according to the inclusion and exclusion criteria. In control group (n=8) conventional interocclusal splint was used and in study group (n=8) the proposed intermediate stent was used.

detailed_description.textblock: Background: Dentofacial deformities have many negative consequences in the form and function of head and neck region. This includes breathing, swallowing, speech and temporomandibular disorders. It is estimated that in about 19% of orthodontic patients, orthognathic surgery is required along with the orthodontic procedure. The introduction of CAD/CAM technology in orthognathic surgery planning has facilitated the procedure and allowed for more predicted results. Aim of this study: The aim of the present study is to propose a new design of the intermediate stent that relates the mobilized maxilla to a fixed anatomical landmark in the skull which would allow for more accurate positioning of the maxilla during orthognathic surgery. Materials and methods: This study was conducted on sixteen patients who have been undergone Le Fort I osteotomy procedure. Eight of them (group A) were treated via a conventional stent while the other eight patients (group B) via a CAD/CAM bone-borne stent. Postoperative patient evaluation was performed by comparing the predicted maxillary position to the resultant position postoperatively. This was done via 3D reconstruction CT scans.

primary_outcome.description: Superimposition error between planned and actual maxillary position

secondary_outcome.description: Pain assessed by score from 0 to 10 with 0 no pain and 10 severe unbearable pain.
Time of the surgery using the splint

arm_group.description: Interocclusal conventional splint is used to reposition the maxilla.
Bone-borne splint is used to reposition the maxilla.

intervention.description: 3D printed splint that repositions the maxilla with the zygomatic buttress as a reference.
Interocclusal splint that relies on the centric relation of the condyle as well as occlusion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with dentofacial deformity requiring Le Fort I osteotomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with severe asymmetry

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant lecturer of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery
